intro: Artemisia bashkalensis, commonly known as Bashkortostan wormwood, is a perennial shrub native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the sunflower family. It thrives in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Artemisia bashkalensis is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine for its antiseptic and anti-inflammatory effects.
